text: I'm getting some weird JS errors in the page editor when I try to insert or edit custom modules into a flexible column in a coded template. After page reload the modules also become unclickable in the live area as well as in the modules pane. Anyone else experiencing this?
Custom modules in the current design manager giving some really weird issues for us across all portals
How do we get a new member in here? I can't for the life of me remember how I joined this slack
<@U2H1Q3F8R> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U2H1Q3F8R/F92UHTZ8S/invite.png|Invite a member>
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
Hello guys, thank you <@U4RP6AGV9> for the invite!
Welcome Razvan :slightly_smiling_face:

General Question (possible feature request)... Does anyone know if portals get a designated "dev" portal. I know we can do things in Design Manager and build stuff using the preview in there, only problem is if you are doing something like a new blog design, the links in the preview will link to the exisitng blog so you can never truly get a full "dev" enviornment. Likewise, if you wanted to test new features in a blog post, you wouldnt be able to create a new post to test to them out (unless i am missing something). I know we have content staging and all that, I just wasnt sure if every portal get their main portal and then a free "dev" portal as well.

I think it would be better for development (and a cleaner design manager file organization) if clients could have this so we can keep all dev stuff in one area and strictly production stuff in production portal
We have a dev portal, our account rep hooked us up with one
I know our agency has one but our clients dont, just wasnt sure if this was something that you would need to reach out for everytime or not
I've used one before for a client we knew was going to sign, so we were able to get their site built by the time they actually started their contract with us. Our CAM did set it up however
Oh true. No we don’t have one for every client

ill make note to reach out to CAMs then. For clients new to HS we have been able to build it out as well before making the switch but for clients on HS where they want a new site, we have been doing alot of the dev in the design manager preview and its fine until we get to blog post changes as its kind of a "once live we can test stuff"

Yeah, that can be a pain... I wonder if it might be easier to include a test domain or something so you don't have to totally abandon the production portal. Sort of like if the client was enterprise, you could hook up an additional subdomain and configure separate website settings there.
agreed. I like the separate portals because of the amount of ideas customers get you can simply whip one up and then your not stuck with tons of random templates in your prod portal
Anyone know an easy way to transfer HS blogs from one portal to another. I'm having zero luck with Skyvia at the moment
Hey AJ, I use <https://github.com/williamspiro/hub-batch> for bulk content management. I have actually been wanting to build post creation into this which could make this really easy
I had to use the API
But getting the topics and authoprs to line up was a pain that didnt fully work
<@U25PYL3Q8> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U25PYL3Q8/F93SZLRHU/image.png|menu options>
I'm trying to get a menu to display all child pages of the current page from this side menu
I have the menu selected, but for some reason it is showing so much more
it appears that it just changes the active branch of the menu, so it isn't really just spitting out two items, it spits out the whole menu
Anyone having issues with custom module rich text fields? For some reason it won't let me do styling inside of the editor (headings/paragraph tags etc..)
<https://github.com/williamspiro/hub-batch/pull/5/files>

Was it stripping all your html? We are having a client now where all the html gets stripped out, leaving us with plain text. Weird thing is we can paste the html in the editor view (not the source code view) and it works then.
yeah that's exactly it
Thanks <@U6KTCR3B3> that fixed it. Hopefully someone on the HubSpot team will see this and fix it.
I'm worried it will break again once it's fixed and output that html as plain text. Hope your client doesn't have a live site with this haha.
Hi all – ignore other awkward styling, but does anyone know how to get the radio icons to display side by side, rather than stack vertically?
```.inputs-list li { display: inline-block; }```
sweet! thanks. also random, anyone know how to remove weird beveled edge from a form submit button? Screenshot coming
dark blue edge
That's gonna depend on your theme, but you're probably looking at a `text-shadow` <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-shadow>
